definition[0]: a formal dance or party where people wear masks and unusual clothes
definition[1]: a way of behaving or speaking that hides your true thoughts or feelings
example[0]: She didn’t really love him, but she kept up the masquerade for the children’s sake.
definition[2]: to pretend to be something or someone different
example[1]: A number of police officers masqueraded as demonstrators.
example[2]: Some of these breakfast foods are just candy masquerading as cereals.
example[3]: He was masquerading under a false name.
